Ho Chi Minh City police have ordered the urgent arrest
and temporary detention of many people in the
ring.  The adultery broker for foreign customers
is headed by a 47-year-old
Korean citizen. According to the investigation, the owner of a
shop in District 7 has recruited staff to
solicit and sell tattoos to customers with this
method of operation.  sophisticated to cover up
illegal acts until October 3, the
Ho Chi Minh City Criminal Police Department coordinated with District 7 police to conduct an
administrative inspection of the above restaurant and
discovered dozens of waitresses.
Khang was dressed loosely to prepare to receive guests. In addition, the
police also confiscated many
documents and evidence related to the

Korean guests at a hotel room in District 7
working with the agency.  Police officers and the
subjects admitted that after eating, drinking and
singing at Nhac Hang, the
broker manager bought ginseng with four female hostesses
of Nhat Hang for 3 million VND
per guest per
night today.  District 6 of
Ho Chi Minh City is continuing to
investigate to clarify the cause of the fire in a four-
story house that occurred on Minh Phung street last
night.
Initial information was around 9 p.m. In the evening,
the fire broke out on the fourth floor of the house
and then quickly broke out.  The fire quickly spread and discovered that there was a
fire. People immediately shouted and tried to put out their
tongues, but failed. At this time,
four people were living in the house. They
promptly escaped safely and received the news to the
Fire Department and rescued them.
Trop Sau rescue team quickly arrived
and by about 10 p.m., the fire was basically
controlled. Until this morning, the house
continued to be sealed off to collect
damage statistics to serve the
investigation of the container truck driver.  Falling asleep
while driving caused the car to hit the sidewalk and
crush a series of kiosks. The incident happened early
this morning in the Tsunami Bridge area of
Thu Duc City, Ho Chi
Minh City around 1:00 a.m. when a container truck
was running.  From Song Than Industrial Park
to Highway 1, when arriving at the
Song Than Overpass area, he suddenly jumped onto the sidewalk, crashed
into a series of roadside kiosks, then
lay down in front of the door. He heard
loud noises and people ran
away in panic.  On the street, a number of people were trapped
inside because the container was blocking the
way with many pieces of concrete and
iron bars blocking them.
Initially, the driver admitted that he
slept until 600 a.m. The container truck was
removed. The police are working with kiosk owners
to calculate the damage.
Around 8:00 a.m. this morning, the truck was circulating
on Highway 14 heading from Dak Nong province.
Going to Ho Chi Minh City, when arriving at Duc
Lieu commune, Bu Dang district, he collided with
a woman's motorbike. Carrying two
children in the same direction, he crashed so hard
that the two children died on the spot and
the woman was injured.  Serious injuries were taken to
the emergency room, then the cause of the accident
is being investigated and clarified by the authorities. This
morning, the entire people of An Giang province
opened a first instance trial to judge five nine
provincial traffic police officers on charges of crime.
Taking advantage of position and authority while
performing official duties to issue more than 5,000 car license plates
against regulations. The leader of this group is
Nguyen Ba District, 61 years old, former Head of the
Road Traffic Police Department of
An
Giang Provincial Police according to the indictment.  In order to create fairness,
equality and transparency for
everyone, the Ministry of Public Security and related units
have deployed road motor vehicle registration and management software
nationwide on the issuance of license plates.
in the form of random number dialing
equipped with an electronic screen displaying the
results of the number plate dialing. However, in the
process of performing the task of issuing car license plates
to vehicle owners from August
2012 to June 2021  Nguyen Ba District
directed four suspects to take
advantage of their positions and powers with copy C to
illegally enter the software to choose and issue
car license plates as desired for themselves
and their acquaintances.
regulates a total of 556 license plates, including 4,175 license
plates issued by swapping teams 81 license plates
issued by entering old data to obtain license
plates directly. The trial is expected to last
for five days from October 7 to 11 in
the morning.  Currently, a female tourist fell
into a deep abyss at Vinh Luong Pass in
Nha Trang city, Khanh Hoa province, but
the rescue force arrived promptly to
rescue the
victim. The 24-year-old female tourist and a
friend came to the area.  Pham Van Dong street,
Vinh Luong commune to take photos.
Unfortunately, he slipped and fell down the cliff. After receiving a
text message, Khanh Hoa province police
dispatched rescue forces to the scene
and quickly saved the victim, the girl
with a broken leg.  left with many injuries
to the face and head but not serious. The
victim was given first aid and then transferred to
Khanh Hoa Provincial Hospital for treatment.

fourth consecutive time. Recently, in Ninh Hoa town,
Khanh Hoa province, there have been many cases of
theft of electric poles on the
110 KV line, after an investigation,
Ninh Hoa town police have just announced that they have arrested the
suspect who carried out the above thefts
according to a report from
Hanh Hoa Electricity Joint Stock Company of 110 KV line due to the
complaint.  This manager had a
total of 262 electric pole ballast rods and 570
bolts stolen in many areas.
Ninh Hoa town police conducted an investigation of the
scene and organized a force to search for
subjects and search for additional items.  On
the evening of October 5, the
authorities issued a decision to prosecute the defendant and
ordered the defendant to be temporarily detained for
28-year-old Quach The Hao, a resident of Ninh
Thuy ward, Ninh Hoa town, at the police station.
Hao admitted that because he did not have a
stable job and needed money to spend, he
had the idea of ​​stealing. At about 11:00
p.m., the subject rode his motorbike to
electric poles located far from residential areas and quickly removed the
ballast bars and took them away.  sold to a scrap facility. The
police confiscated a
total of 276 v-shaped sharp bars of
various sizes with a total weight
of more than 3.8
tons. This is the end of our 60 Seconds program today.
